brewery.brewery_description:
True character isn’t made overnight. In fact, it’s something we’ve had brewing for over 245 years.

Home to Badger and Outland Beers, the Badger Brewery is a state-of-the-art, independent and family-owned brewery which now stands proudly alongside our old brewery on the banks of the River Stour in Blandford, Dorset.

beer.beer_description:
**Not to be confused with the Wicked Wyvern Limited Edition Strong Ale at 7.4%**

This refreshing West Coast style IPA is brewed with Amarillo, Cascade and Mosaic hops, which deliver a citrus aroma of grapefruit, a bitter hop character and a dry hoppy finish.

items.badge_description: 99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 110 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 23!

beer.beer_description:
Weighing in at a 4% ABV, straight from the fields of Dorset, the ‘Purbeck Prize Fighter’ – Hopping Hare. A knockout pale ale inspired by its punchy, hoppy namesakes.

Others may challenge but this contender’s got heart and a big citrus hook that gets you right in the tastebuds. Light and perfectly balanced with Cascade and Amarillo® hops – we know who’s corner we’re in.

And the crowd goes wild! Only years of dedicated practice gets you to the top of the podium. No one knows this better than our light but mighty Golden Champion.

Bright, crisp and floral, this winner of a golden ale gets its refreshing elderflower notes from Goldings and WGV hops. Medal-worthy indeed. But unlike the vaulting harvest mouse, you won’t have to bend over backwards to enjoy it.
The subtle elderflower aromas of this delicately floral brew are reminiscent of a summer's evening.

A truly spectacular Indian pale ale, made from a tasty trio of Amarillo, Cascade and Mosaic hops to give it a deep bronze colour, punchy citrus flavours, and a powerful hop character.

Citrus and pine aromas take you away to sun drenched coastal forests.

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 425 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 86!

beer.beer_description:
Roasted and rich, with coffee and caramel notes 

Back in the presence of greatness. The Master Stoat is just like any demanding artisan. A complex perfectionist, this temptuously rich character could never be accused of being 'one note'.

Dark and brooding with a sweet side, toffee meets coffee in a brew that's sure to tantalise the most discerning of palates.

2023 World Beer Awards - Bronze England Winner (Flavoured Beer)

2023 Great Taste Awards – 1 star

items.badge_description: Beer is often better with friends. Besides, drinking socially is what we're all about! You've checked in with at least 10 other people within 5 hours.
Drinking with friends is fun. Right? You've checked in with at least 4 other people within 2 hours.

Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!
You're exploring this great country the best way possible, one delicious beer at a time! That's one beer while in at least 5 states or countries.

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 10 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 3!

Others may challenge but this contender’s got heart and a big citrus hook that gets you right in the tastebuds. Light and perfectly balanced with Cascade and Amarillo® hops – we know who’s corner we’re in.

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly what’s on tap! That's 50 check-ins at venue that is verified. Try 5 more for Level 11!
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 5 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 2.

items.checkin_comment:
Last one was so shite I put it down the drain.
The drain has since complained

beer.beer_description:
Keep this beer close to hand. Our Fursty Ferret amber ale takes its name from a real ferret with a taste for full-bodied, biscuity beer and a mischievous reputation.

‘Little thief’ by (Latin) name and opportunistic by nature, his memory lives on in the Gribble Inn. And who can blame him? With lemony, floral aromas of Celia, Cascade and Centennial hops, and the moreish-ly malty backbone of Premium Ale malt.

items.badge_description: 99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 40 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 9!

Whether you’re feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 10 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 3!

user.bio: I like when liquids contain alcohol

beer.beer_description:
Keep this beer close to hand. Our Fursty Ferret amber ale takes its name from a real ferret with a taste for full-bodied, biscuity beer and a mischievous reputation.

‘Little thief’ by (Latin) name and opportunistic by nature, his memory lives on in the Gribble Inn. And who can blame him? With lemony, floral aromas of Celia, Cascade and Centennial hops, and the moreish-ly malty backbone of Premium Ale malt.

Deep in the reeds of the River Stour, it lies in wait. Patiently. Ready for unsuspecting prey. Once feared by those who fish these waters, was the ferocious bite of the infamous Blandford Fly. Craftier fishermen know of a different Blandford Fly...

One with a sweeter side and refreshing notes of ginger (said to soothe the dastardly fly’s bite). And with hints of toffee to offset the spice, we think you’ll agree this unique golden ale is quite the catch.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 55 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 12!

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 180 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 37!

beer.beer_description:
The second in the series of Founder's Day beers that celebrate key people from our history. John and Edward Woodhouse were brothers who brought complimentary sells to the important business of brewing characterful ales.

Known affectionately as “The Chairman", Edward was a sharp businessman and keen sportsman having captained Somerset County Cricket. John was all about the beer, and as head brewer he created numerous championship winning ales.
Together they epitomised the Teamwork that still runs through Hall & Woodhouse.

To celebrate we've crafted a powerful Singe
Ale, just like we did in the 1960s and 70. Brewed to a punchy 9% with a deep chestnut brown colour and perfectly balanced hops for a robustly bitter finish.

Keep this beer close to hand. Our Fursty Ferret amber ale takes its name from a real ferret with a taste for full-bodied, biscuity beer and a mischievous reputation.

‘Little thief’ by (Latin) name and opportunistic by nature, his memory lives on in the Gribble Inn. And who can blame him? With lemony, floral aromas of Celia, Cascade and Centennial hops, and the moreish-ly malty backbone of Premium Ale malt.

It was a tasting that started like any other. Yet the night that ensued became one for the history books. The beer we sipped was so golden and delicious that it had everyone and their dog celebrating into the wee hours of the morning. Such is the legend of our Tangle Foot.

Brewed by former head brewer John Woodhouse, this magical blend of Challenger and Goldings hops holds a delicate floral aroma and legendary status.

Weighing in at a 4% ABV, straight from the fields of Dorset, the ‘Purbeck Prize Fighter’ – Hopping Hare. A knockout pale ale inspired by its punchy, hoppy namesakes.

Others may challenge but this contender’s got heart and a big citrus hook that gets you right in the tastebuds. Light and perfectly balanced with Cascade and Amarillo® hops – we know who’s corner we’re in.

And the crowd goes wild! Only years of dedicated practice gets you to the top of the podium. No one knows this better than our light but mighty Golden Champion.

Bright, crisp and floral, this winner of a golden ale gets its refreshing elderflower notes from Goldings and WGV hops. Medal-worthy indeed. But unlike the vaulting harvest mouse, you won’t have to bend over backwards to enjoy it.
The subtle elderflower aromas of this delicately floral brew are reminiscent of a summer's evening.

A local legend with a penchant for jewel toned treasures, the Cranborne Poacher lives a fruitful, yet elusive lifestyle. Some say you would only know its existence by the damson trees picked clean in Cranborne Chase. 

Enigmatic, rich and full-bodied, this ruby ale hoards a cache of complex flavour with notes of wild fruits, liquorice and chocolate malt. What a find.

Deep in the reeds of the River Stour, it lies in wait. Patiently. Ready for unsuspecting prey. Once feared by those who fish these waters, was the ferocious bite of the infamous Blandford Fly. Craftier fishermen know of a different Blandford Fly...

One with a sweeter side and refreshing notes of ginger (said to soothe the dastardly fly’s bite). And with hints of toffee to offset the spice, we think you’ll agree this unique golden ale is quite the catch.

A brave seafarer with quite the backstory, Golden Glory is now anchored in home waters for good.

Loyal fans and intrepid explorers prepare to embark on a voyage of flavour, with lashings of fruity peach and a wave of floral aromas. 

Juicy? Absolutely. Golden? Gloriously so. We've really pushed the boat out with this one.

A truly spectacular Indian pale ale, made from a tasty trio of Amarillo, Cascade and Mosaic hops to give it a deep bronze colour, punchy citrus flavours, and a powerful hop character.

Citrus and pine aromas take you away to sun drenched coastal forests.

LIGHT AND HAZY – LIKE LONG SUMMER DAYS AT LULWORTH COVE.

Light in colour, deep in flavour. Soak up bold citrus and fruity tropical notes in this refreshingly sessionable pale ale, brewed with Citra and Amarillo hops.

An auburn coloured, refreshing beer. The beer combines our finest Flagon ale malt with a small amount of crystal malt to give a subtle malt character. 

The beer was inspired and developed with the hop growers and merchants Charles Faram. The Celeia, Bobek and Dana hops provide a refreshing hop that is both thirst quenching and characterful. The hops are added both in the brewhouse and dry hopped in FV to ensure this ale retains its character to the last drop.

Roasted and rich, with coffee and caramel notes 

Back in the presence of greatness. The Master Stoat is just like any demanding artisan. A complex perfectionist, this temptuously rich character could never be accused of being 'one note'.

Dark and brooding with a sweet side, toffee meets coffee in a brew that's sure to tantalise the most discerning of palates.

2023 World Beer Awards - Bronze England Winner (Flavoured Beer)

2023 Great Taste Awards – 1 star

BOLD. UNWAVERING. A REAL ONE OF A KIND – JUST LIKE DORSET'S OLD HARRY ROCKS.

Spicy ginger takes centre stage in this hazy pale ale, brewed with WGV and Goldings hops. Expect refreshing, balanced yet punchy flavours.

Pair with: an obscenely big plate of spicy chicken wings and dancing the night away.

2023 World Beer Awards - England Gold and Country Winner (Flavoured Beer)

DARK AND DELICIOUS, A SMUGGLER'S BEST KEPT SECRET.

This smooth stout harbours indulgent flavours of cocoa, coconut and vanilla, along with dark, roasted malt and subtle hop notes – a recipe that's earnt us four internationally recognised brewing awards.

Pair with: a slap-up steak dinner and a roaring fire after a day exploring the coves.

2023 Great Taste Awards – 2 stars

Portland Poster, our characterful session ale, is a firm favourite in any surroundings. Its copper coloured appearance and earthy nature mean you'll never return to sender.

A local hero that always delivers – the Portland Poster is a trusty choice, round after round, whatever the weather.

Fresh and easy-drinking, with a malty, hoppy character and a balanced bitterness – it really is the whole package.

LIGHT. FRUITY. REFRESHING.

This sublime fruit lager reminds us of vibrant coastal sunsets.

Wow-worthy peach notes complement the zingy freshness of the Huell Melon and Hallertau Blanc hops.

Light and refreshing with hints of citrus​

A refreshing cask ale that uses the revered hop variety Citra, which builds on the light base from the lager malt. 

For added interest, the beer is fermented with lager Yeast making it uniquely refreshing for a cask ale. 

Light in colour and body with powerful citrus hop notes, it’s the perfect summer pint.

Winter’s Tale is a deep chestnut brown colour with an aroma of subtle fruity hop from acclaimed British Harlequin hops. 

Crystal, Pale and Chocolate malts along with a robust 4.7% ABV deliver a  full-bodied taste, with notes of bourbon biscuit and a hoppy finish.

Hints of toffee, deliciously pulled espresso and chocolate notes – our Outland Coffee Stout is the perfect pint to enjoy by the fire.

This traditional stout combines a masterful balance of rich, roasted notes from chocolate and crystal malts with caramelised biscuit, and delivers a smooth coffee experience from the first sip to the last.

LIGHT AND REFRESHING IPL WITH HOPPY CITRUS

Who says you can’t have the best of both worlds? 

We’ve smashed together the flavour of refreshing premium lager and a modern hazy IPA to create a truly unique India Pale Lager hybrid.

A trio of banging hops bring the refreshment of lager and the bold pine and citrus of a classic IPA. The greatest combo since beer gardens and long summer evenings.

Pair with: a stacked chicken burger with as much chilli sauce as you can handle.

A sessionable pale ale with hints of mango. ​

Tropical fruit and Mango are balanced by moreish biscuity notes and Cascade & Amarillo Hops. This fruity Pale Ale is the perfect accompaniment to an epic coastal sunset.​ 

With juicy mango and vibrant tropical notes, enjoy a pint after a long day on the beach with a massive plate of spicy, cheesy nachos!

Discover a path less travelled

We don’t believe in gatekeeping, so we’ve brewed our own classic draught stout. It hits all the right notes, it just happens to be brewed in Dorset.

Smooth, dark and creamy with a perfect head and exceptional balance from roasted malts and a touch of caramel sweetness.
